title: Pitt Menu Parser
paragraphs: This project is a full-stack system I am in the process of creating for my undergraduate Capstone Project. It uses Python to parse PDF menus posted on the campus dining hall website. The Menus are parsed using Pandas, and are then uploaded to a MySQL database. I designed in the database myself and normalized to prevent repetition of data. After that I developed an Node.JS REST API that reads the database information and presents it a a public endpoint for GET requests at Api.JoelAustin.Net.

There are various front-end applications that take advantage of the information from the REST API. One being a social network that surrounds the menus, where users can upload images of the menu items for everyone to see. Another front-end use is delivering the information to Google Home and Amazon Echo with Google Actions and Alexa Skills Respectively.
View More:
GitHub Repository

title: DormStack
paragraphs:
This mobile application was created for the 2018 University of Pittsburgh Mobile App Challenge. The application placed Second and I was awarded $2000 dollars for the project. It is a social media app that helps college students living in dorms find, create, and share events easiler.

title: JoelAustin.Net
paragraphs: JoelAustin.Net is this website. it is made in react for the purpose of showcasing my work to any who are interested in what I love to do. JoelAustin.Net has undergone many iterations over my 4 years as an undergraduate, and I hope that images below display how far I've come in my career.

title: BABL Language App
paragraphs:
This is an Android Mobile Application created from January to March 2017. It too won second place in the Pitt Mobile App Challenge, but to the 2017 year. It implements 'tinder-esque' matching systems to help users find other's that speak different languages. The application also features Facebook integration for getting user information. This was my first serious attempt at creating a fully featured mobile app.
